entry.title: Fănuș Neagu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that writer Fănuș Neagu (pictured) claimed to have spent the Romanian floods of May 1970 stranded with a feral wolf on the roof of a cannery?

entry.title: bans abortion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sierra Leone is the only country where a British law from 1861 still bans abortion?

entry.title: Lewis Worthington Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lewis Worthington Smith received royalties from his textbook The Mechanism of English Style for 20 years?

entry.title: Ling Nam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tomas Fung founded the predecessor of the restaurant Ling Nam with only 3,000 Philippine pesos?

entry.title: Lothar von Falkenhausen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lothar von Falkenhausen was appointed an honorary professor of Zhejiang University, an honor usually reserved for Nobel Prize winners?

entry.title: break rooms (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, a United States regulatory agency, does not require workplaces to have employee break rooms?

entry.title: Riley Gale (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a critic compared vocalist Riley Gale to a "rabid wolf"?

entry.title: The Strip (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Strip documents how the gangster Meyer Lansky would walk his Shih Tzu near the pool while visiting a casino?

entry.title: The Motherland Calls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a woman was sentenced to 10 months of forced labor when she "tickled" the breasts of The Motherland Calls?
